subclassFeature.name: Ocean Domain
entries: You invoke the power of salt and sea-the fountain of life-in all its chaotic glory. You are an emissary between sea and shore.

entries.subclassFeature: Envoy to the Waves|Cleric||Ocean|MHH: Ocean Domain Cleric|1

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Ocean Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

entries.caption: Passions Domain Spells
rows: {@spell locate animals or plants}, {@spell misty step}
{@spell conjure minor elementals} (excluding fire), {@spell evard's black tentacles}

subclassFeature.name: Envoy to the Waves
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you learn the {@spell chill touch} cantrip.
You also learn the {@language Primordial||Aquan}, gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival} skill, and gain proficiency with tridents and nets.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Sea Speaker
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to communicate telepathically with aquatic creatures within 100 feet of you. This ability lasts for 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: At Home in the Waves
entries: At 6th level, you gain a swim speed of 30 feet and darkvision 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range extends by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Scales of the Sea
entries: At 17th level, you become able to breathe in water as easily as in air. You also gain the ability to transform your skin into fishlike scales at will. While covered in scales, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in natural underwater environments.

You must use an action to grow the scales or to transform back to your normal skin. The scales can be any color you choose. The scales need to be kept wet; you gain one level of exhaustion at the end of each hour when you have scales and they arenâ€™t thoroughly wetted with a quart or more of water at least once.
